# Project: njambe - Ultimate LLM Setup Guide

> **njambe** is a neighborhood-based services marketplace connecting users with local service providers, modeled after [RingTwice](https://ringtwice.be). This guide provides the context, technical stack, and architectural rules for AI-assisted development (vibe coding).

## Project Context & Guidelines

- **App Name**: njambe
- **Business Model**: A marketplace for local services (cleaning, gardening, repairs, etc.) connecting neighbors.
- **UI Approach**: 
    - Inspired by RingTwice but with unique "njambe" branding.
    - **Component Library**: [React Native Reusables](https://reactnativereusables.com/docs) is the primary UI source.
    - **Rule**: Always prefer React Native Reusables components. Use `npx @react-native-reusables/cli@latest add [component-name]` to install.
    - **Customization**: Only build custom components when React Native Reusables does not provide a suitable primitive.
- **Strict Component Usage**: **Always** prioritize and use React Native Reusables components. Avoid hardcoding UI elements or creating custom components if a suitable Reusables component exists. The goal is to maximize reusability and maintain consistency.

## Code Organization Pattern (MANDATORY)

Follow this structure strictly for all new features and pages:

### 1. Components Structure
```text
components/
├── ui/                           # React Native Reusables (shadcn/ui)
│   ├── button.tsx
│   ├── text.tsx
│   └── ...
└── custom/                       # Page-specific or shared custom comp    ├── [route_name]/             # e.g., start/, customer/, provider/, auth/
    │   └── [page_name]/          # Specific page within a route
    │       ├── component.tsx     # Individual components              # Barrel export
    └── shared/                   # Shared across multiple pages
        ├── Header.tsx
        ├── LocationSelector.tsx
        └── index.ts
```

### 2. Data & Library Structure
```text
lib/
├── utils.ts                      # Utility functions (e.g., cn helper)
├── theme.ts                      # Theme configuration
└── [page_name]/                  # Data specific to a page
    └── [data_name].ts            # e.g., service-providers.ts, categories.ts
```

### 3. Rules for New Pages
1. **Extract Data**: Move static data or logic to `lib/[page_name]/[data_name].ts`.
2. **Extract Components**: Move UI chunks to `components/custom/[route_name]/[page_name]/component.tsx`.
3. **Barrel Exports**: Every folder in `components/custom/` must have an `index.ts`.
4. **Lean Pages**: Page files in `app/` should only handle layout and orchestration.
